SEARCH
Package main.java.neat.config

Class ActivationConfigBuilder

java.lang.Object
main.java.neat.config.ActivationConfigBuilder
public class ActivationConfigBuilder extends Object
Builder class for creating and configuring ActivationConfig instances. This class implements the Builder pattern to provide a fluent API for configuring activation functions in a NEAT implementation. It allows for method chaining to set multiple parameters in a readable and maintainable way. Example usage: 
 ActivationConfig config = new ActivationConfigBuilder()
     .addActivationFunction(ACTIVATION_FUNCTION.SIGMOID)
     .addActivationFunction(ACTIVATION_FUNCTION.RELU)
     .setSigmoidActivationThreshold(0.3)
     .setReluLeak(0.1)
     .build();
Author:
Taher Joudeh

  • Constructor Details

    • ActivationConfigBuilder

      public ActivationConfigBuilder()
      Creates a new ActivationConfigBuilder with an empty ActivationConfig. The created ActivationConfig has no activation functions allowed by default.

  • Method Details

    • addActivationFunction

      public ActivationConfigBuilder addActivationFunction(ActivationFunction.ACTIVATION_FUNCTION activationFunction)
      Adds an activation function to the list of allowed functions. This method allows the NEAT algorithm to use the specified activation function during network evolution. Multiple activation functions can be added by calling this method multiple times.
      Parameters:
      activationFunction - The activation function to allow in the network
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining

    • setSigmoidActivationThreshold

      public ActivationConfigBuilder setSigmoidActivationThreshold(double threshold)
      Sets the activation threshold for the sigmoid function. The sigmoid activation threshold determines the input value at which the activation is considered "on" (1) or "off" (0). Default value is 0.5.
      Parameters:
      threshold - The threshold value for the sigmoid activation function
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining

    • setTanhActivationThreshold

      public ActivationConfigBuilder setTanhActivationThreshold(double threshold)
      Sets the activation threshold for the tanh function. The tanh activation threshold determines the input value at which the activation is considered "on" (1) or "off" (-1). Default value is 0.
      Parameters:
      threshold - The threshold value for the tanh activation function
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining

    • setStepActivationThreshold

      public ActivationConfigBuilder setStepActivationThreshold(double threshold)
      Sets the activation threshold for the step function. The step activation threshold determines the input value at which the function output steps from 0 to 1. Default value is 0.
      Parameters:
      threshold - The threshold value for the step activation function
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining

    • setReluActivationThreshold

      public ActivationConfigBuilder setReluActivationThreshold(double threshold)
      Sets the activation threshold for the ReLU function. The ReLU activation threshold determines the input value below which the output is zero. Default value is 0.
      Parameters:
      threshold - The threshold value for the ReLU activation function
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining

    • setLinearActivationThreshold

      public ActivationConfigBuilder setLinearActivationThreshold(double threshold)
      Sets the activation threshold for the linear function. The linear activation threshold provides an offset to the linear function. Default value is 0.
      Parameters:
      threshold - The threshold value for the linear activation function
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining

    • setReluLeak

      public ActivationConfigBuilder setReluLeak(double leak)
      Sets the leak parameter for Leaky ReLU activation. The leak parameter determines the slope of the ReLU function for inputs below the activation threshold. A value of 0 gives standard ReLU behavior, while positive values allow some signal to "leak through" for negative inputs.
      Parameters:
      leak - The leak value for Leaky ReLU (typically a small positive value like 0.01). If less than zero, the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining

    • build

      public ActivationConfig build()
      Builds and returns the configured ActivationConfig instance. This method finalizes the building process and returns the fully configured ActivationConfig object. After calling this method, the builder should no longer be used.
      Returns:
      The configured ActivationConfig instance
